meanings.definition: An adherent of an ideology, especially one who is uncompromising and dogmatic in their beliefs.
meanings.sent1: The ideologue refused to consider any other viewpoints.
meanings.sent2: She is known as an ideologue for her strong political beliefs.
meanings.sent3: The ideologue insisted on eating only green foods to match her environmental ideology.
meanings.sent4: His rigid beliefs turned him into an ideologue, unable to see beyond his own convictions.
meanings.sent5: The image of the ideologue with closed ears symbolizes stubbornness in beliefs.

meanings.definition: A person who zealously advocates for a particular ideology.
meanings.sent1: As an ideologue, he tirelessly promoted his party's agenda.
meanings.sent2: The environmental ideologue campaigned for stricter pollution laws.
meanings.sent3: The ideologue's passion for recycling led to a house full of reused items.
meanings.sent4: She was an ideologue for peace, spreading her message through art and music.
meanings.sent5: The ideologue's fiery speeches ignited a sense of purpose in his followers.
